column4: If I download a program, how do I install it?  I don't seem to be able to do the ./configure, make, make install method? :S
installing the traditional way will likely to break your system, you should use a properly compiled deb.
did you check getdeb.net?
I'm downloading the Thunderbird tarball, what is its content?
is there any Makefile in there?
no, it
so it's a binary package, is there any executable?. WHat does the README say?
the package is ~11MB so it will take me a few minutes to download.
yep.
How's it going, old chap?
it's a binary package, if you have a file manager, just double click on 'thunderbird' is OK.
yep, it should work :)
Anyway I can add the application to the Applications -> Internet menu?
sure, the GNOME menu isn't very flexible in that regard though. You'll have to use Alacarte: right-click on the Main Menu->Edit
it should be as easy as dragging-n-dropping to the menu though
Everytime I run it, I have to use the 'thunderbird' file I just used?
yeah, or add a new item to the main menu which points to that file.
thunderbird compiled in a DEB package will have an icon in the menu and everything in place automatically.
But how does one get a deb package of it if it's not at getdeb? :p
compile one ;)
alright, I'll give it a shot.
have to waste another 5 mins again to download source, sigh.
I'll be back in a few minutes.
